channel.description:
lol.
[code]------------------- Updater - By Nueb35 -------------------
Loading classes... Done, loaded 276 classes.
Loading hooks... Done, loaded 7 hooks.
Hooking...
- Character ^ bl implements updater.hooks.Character - bl.getMessage() returns bl.tb * HP Ratio not hooked. * Cycle fields not hooked. - Client ^ client implements updater.hooks.Client - client.getLoginIndex() returns nc.Z - client.getSettingsArray() returns pf.P - client.getPlayerCount() returns hi.k - client.getPlayerIndexArray() returns ab.b - client.getPlayerArray() returns vi.W - client.getNPCCount() returns ki.b - client.getNPCIndexArray() returns ij.db - client.getNPCArray() returns qf.cb - client.getInterfaces2() returns fi.b - client.getInterfaces1() returns eg.b - Interface ^ wj implements updater.hooks.Interface - wj.getChildren() returns wj.Lc - NPC ^ bc implements updater.hooks.NPC - bc.getNPCDef() returns bc.Wb - NPCDef ^ hd implements updater.hooks.NPCDef - hd.getName() returns hd.ib - hd.getActions() returns hd.I * Type not hooked. - Player ^ si implements updater.hooks.Player * Name not hooked. * Level not hooked. - StringWrapper ^ jd implements updater.hooks.StringWrapper - jd.getBytes() returns jd.w - jd.getHash() returns jd.C - jd.length() returns jd.eb - jd.isEditable() returns jd.ob - jd.toString() fixed
Done.
Packing jar... Done.
------------------- Client version : #514 Identified 7 classes. Hooked 19 fields. ------------------- [/code]
all sorts of things broke... as always StringWrapper hooks perfectly.

item.dc:creator: @henry henry
item.description:
@henry wrote:

[quote=“qauters, post:24, topic:236824”][quote author=henry link=topic=312636.msg2493346#msg2493346 date=1224270854]

Not true, there are still two clients. Switching between low and high detail will reload the page. Just like switching from free to members.
The 1024*768 is only used when running the client stand alone (so from your computer using the main(String[] args) method)

no, the page is not reloaded, like the old world switching it simply changes the Socket’s host to the corresponding world, and as for high detail, it does not reload either it simply uses the full width/height of the client.

Made a slight mistake saying it, world switching now doesn’t switch to free worlds (from member). It will just fail at login, while the old one did switch.
The low/high detail on the login page are both the HD client. If it fails to load, the old client will be used.

But there are still two clients, which was the point I wanted to make

I see, so, how do you download the two separate clients…?

Also, I would like to use a hd bot while playing on my main or something, and if I only have 1 bot running I don’t care how much CPU it takes up. Or maybe I want to play while using my bot just so it can tell me about things going on even if im not autoing?

But why do you think hd would take up less CPU, I’m curious, because it seems like hd is for people with faster PCs? Or does it only take up more memory, graphics processing?
[/quote]
HD uses hardware acceleration, meaning it will also use the gpu (our graphics card). Instead of only your main cpu.
But it takes more cpu as far as I can see, probably uses more calculation for other things. Instead of only for rendering.

You can download the clients here:
Normal client: http://world53.runescape.com/runescape.jar
HD client: http://world53.runescape.com/runescape_gl.pack200
The pack200 is also packed with GZIP. And the first two bytes are removed, search for PSB’s updater to find out how to unpack it.

Or just download them from http://www.moparisthebest.com/rs
You can find instructions how to convert here: http://www.moparisthebest.com/rs/tools/ RsPack200ToJar.java

Btw: Moparisthebest, you should also do version check on the HD client. Version finder should work on both.[/quote]

Thanks a bunch! I didn’t realize that was the hd client lol.

EDIT: Nvm… don’t even answer that >< lmao.

Read full topic

[quote=“henry, post:23, topic:236824”][quote author=qauters link=topic=312636.msg2493079#msg2493079 date=1224255923]

Not true, there are still two clients. Switching between low and high detail will reload the page. Just like switching from free to members.
The 1024*768 is only used when running the client stand alone (so from your computer using the main(String[] args) method)

no, the page is not reloaded, like the old world switching it simply changes the Socket’s host to the corresponding world, and as for high detail, it does not reload either it simply uses the full width/height of the client.

Made a slight mistake saying it, world switching now doesn’t switch to free worlds (from member). It will just fail at login, while the old one did switch.
The low/high detail on the login page are both the HD client. If it fails to load, the old client will be used.

But there are still two clients, which was the point I wanted to make
[/quote]

I see, so, how do you download the two separate clients…?

Also, I would like to use a hd bot while playing on my main or something, and if I only have 1 bot running I don’t care how much CPU it takes up. Or maybe I want to play while using my bot just so it can tell me about things going on even if im not autoing?

But why do you think hd would take up less CPU, I’m curious, because it seems like hd is for people with faster PCs? Or does it only take up more memory, graphics processing?[/quote]
HD uses hardware acceleration, meaning it will also use the gpu (our graphics card). Instead of only your main cpu.
But it takes more cpu as far as I can see, probably uses more calculation for other things. Instead of only for rendering.

You can download the clients here:
Normal client: http://world53.runescape.com/runescape.jar
HD client: http://world53.runescape.com/runescape_gl.pack200
The pack200 is also packed with GZIP. And the first two bytes are removed, search for PSB’s updater to find out how to unpack it.

Or just download them from http://www.moparisthebest.com/rs
You can find instructions how to convert here: http://www.moparisthebest.com/rs/tools/ RsPack200ToJar.java

Btw: Moparisthebest, you should also do version check on the HD client. Version finder should work on both.

item.dc:creator: @chrisn2323 chrisn2323
item.description:
@chrisn2323 wrote:

[quote=“henry, post:16, topic:236824”][quote author=qauters link=topic=312636.msg2491648#msg2491648 date=1224166193]
Btw. they changed standard size of the standalone client to 1024*768 in case nobody noticed yet Which is different then the standard size of the applet (as called used in init).
[/quote]

Yea I had noticed that as well when I was playing yesterday. It allows for easy switching between details within the same client. So this means that there is only 1 client now, and therefor should make it easier for us to have a bot support HD?

If you want to make a reasonably fail safe client checker, then you should search the client methods for a method containing the text “js5crc” then continue search to a checkcast with Socket.

            lc.W = new od((Socket)hc.M.f, of.X);
            kh kh1 = new kh(5);
            kh1.c(-1, 15);
            kh1.c((byte)115, 514);

Get the second invokevirtual, check both arguments for a SIPUSH. If both are SIPUSH, goto the method ( kh.c(B, I) ) and find the next ISHR. Then go back to the previous ILOAD
ILOAD, of course, gives you a variable index, use it to calculate the argument index with (iload_2 would be argument 2 as 0 is this).
Then use your variable index to determine which of the 2 SIPUSH is the right one.

But 80% of the time there is only one SIPUSH, so it remains reasonably quick.

Yea, when I was designing my client version checker, I had looked into it like this, because there wasn’t too many SIPUSH values, but I never finished it because I havn’t had much time to look into… wel anything :/. So for the moment I’m just using one similar to what Mopar posted.[/quote]
why would you want hd on a bot?

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @henry henry
item.description:
@henry wrote:

qauters:

Btw. they changed standard size of the standalone client to 1024*768 in case nobody noticed yet Which is different then the standard size of the applet (as called used in init).

Yea I had noticed that as well when I was playing yesterday. It allows for easy switching between details within the same client. So this means that there is only 1 client now, and therefor should make it easier for us to have a bot support HD?

[quote=“qauters, post:15, topic:236824”]If you want to make a reasonably fail safe client checker, then you should search the client methods for a method containing the text “js5crc” then continue search to a checkcast with Socket.

            lc.W = new od((Socket)hc.M.f, of.X);
            kh kh1 = new kh(5);
            kh1.c(-1, 15);
            kh1.c((byte)115, 514);

Get the second invokevirtual, check both arguments for a SIPUSH. If both are SIPUSH, goto the method ( kh.c(B, I) ) and find the next ISHR. Then go back to the previous ILOAD
ILOAD, of course, gives you a variable index, use it to calculate the argument index with (iload_2 would be argument 2 as 0 is this).
Then use your variable index to determine which of the 2 SIPUSH is the right one.

But 80% of the time there is only one SIPUSH, so it remains reasonably quick.[/quote]
Yea, when I was designing my client version checker, I had looked into it like this, because there wasn’t too many SIPUSH values, but I never finished it because I havn’t had much time to look into… wel anything :/. So for the moment I’m just using one similar to what Mopar posted.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @qauters qauters
item.description:
@qauters wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:3, topic:236824”][quote author=the bank link=topic=312636.msg2490777#msg2490777 date=1224104486]
My client version broke, everything else works though :).
[/quote]

Use this client version:
http://moparisthebest.com/rs/tools/FindVersion.java
It didn’t break, and shouldn’t until 600.[/quote]
It can still break. The could remove the main method, which wouldn’t be strange at all since it’s unused (at least by the users). Just like they removed Signlink from the unsigned jar.
There is a chance that one of the dummy arguments contains a SIPUSH between 503 and 600 ^^.
I do use it though, except I just look in the init method which contains it as well.

Btw. they changed standard size of the standalone client to 1024*768 in case nobody noticed yet Which is different then the standard size of the applet (as called used in init).

If you want to make a reasonably fail safe client checker, then you should search the client methods for a method containing the text “js5crc” then continue search to a checkcast with Socket.

            lc.W = new od((Socket)hc.M.f, of.X);
            kh kh1 = new kh(5);
            kh1.c(-1, 15);
            kh1.c((byte)115, 514);

Get the second invokevirtual, check both arguments for a SIPUSH. If both are SIPUSH, goto the method ( kh.c(B, I) ) and find the next ISHR. Then go back to the previous ILOAD
ILOAD, of course, gives you a variable index, use it to calculate the argument index with (iload_2 would be argument 2 as 0 is this).
Then use your variable index to determine which of the 2 SIPUSH is the right one.

But 80% of the time there is only one SIPUSH, so it remains reasonably quick.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

[quote=“Unhandled, post:9, topic:236824”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=312636.msg2490969#msg2490969 date=1224112590]
Unless they skip a version, or change the jar and keep the same version, then it will break with no warning.
[/quote]
That’s why you use both. Go through the bytecode, then check against the previous version.[/quote]Going through the bytecode renders checking against the previous version redundant.

item.dc:creator: @Metho_D Method
item.description:
@Metho_D wrote:

A few things broke for me, but I was (hopefully) able to fix them.

[code]Downloading and extracting runescape.jar…done.

Runescape Build #514

[ RSString ]
^ jd implements interface RSString

  • getBytes() --> byte[] jd.w
  • getHash() --> int jd.C
  • getLength() --> int jd.eb
  • isEditable() --> boolean jd.ob

[ NPC ]

  • getNPCIndexArray() --> int[] ij.db
  • getNPCArray() --> bc[] qf.cb
    ^ bc implements interface NPC
  • getNPCDef() --> hd bc.Wb
  • getNPCCount() --> int ki.b

[ NPCDef ]
^ hd implements interface NPCDef

  • getNPCActions() --> jd[] hd.I
  • getNPCName() --> jd hd.ib
  • getNPCType() --> int hd.J

[ Player ]

  • getPlayerIndexArray() --> int[] ab.b
  • getPlayerArray() --> gj[] vi.W
    ^ gj implements interface Player
  • getPlayerCount() --> int hi.k

[ PlayerDef ]

  • getPlayerName() --> jd gj.ic
    ^ ie implements interface Model
  • getModel() --> ie gj.xc
    ^ eh implements interface Animable
    ^ qk implements interface Stream
  • getCurrentOffset() --> int qk.R
  • getPkHeadIcon() --> short gj.zc
  • getPrayerHeadIcon() --> short gj.Wb
  • getTeam() --> short gj.zc
  • getLevel() --> int gj.yc

[ Position ]

  • getMyPlayer() --> gj nk.k
  • getLocationY() --> int[] bl.bb
  • getBaseX() --> int ua.G
  • getLocationX() --> int[] bl.Z
  • getBaseY() --> int oi.l

[ Character ]
^ bl implements interface Character

  • getMessage() --> jd bl.tb
  • getAnimation() --> int bl.D
  • getMotion() --> int bl.Y
  • getX() --> int bl.w
  • getY() --> int bl.F

[ Entity ]

  • getPublicChatMode() --> int d.o
  • getHPRatio() --> int bl.Fb
  • getLoopCycleStatus() --> int bl.B
  • getLoopCycle() --> int pj.i
  • getHeight() --> int bl.x

[ InteractingEntity ]

  • getInteracting() --> int bl.Lb
  • getSelfInteracting() --> int tg.o
  • getTurnDirection() --> int bl.kb

[ GroundIntArray ]

  • getGroundIntArray() --> int[][][] vk.V

[ GroundByteArray ]

  • getGroundByteArray() --> byte[][][] jd.T

[ Camera ]

  • getPlane() --> int da.e
  • getCamPosX() --> int hj.g
  • getCamPosY() --> int vd.F
  • getCamPosZ() --> int ub.z

[ CameraCurves ]

  • getCameraCurveY() --> int rb.fb
  • getCameraCurveX() --> int tg.B

[ Interface ]
^ wj implements interface Interface

  • getValueIndexArray() --> int[][] wj.x
  • getCache() --> wj[] wj.Lc
  • getInventory() --> int[] wj.bd
  • getInventoryStackSizes() --> int[] wj.wc
  • getType() --> int wj.fc
  • getActionType() --> int wj.Gc
  • getWidth() --> int wj.w
  • getHeight() --> int wj.Uc
  • getActions() --> jd[] wj.cc
  • isInventoryInterface() --> boolean wj.Tc
  • getText() --> jd wj.wb
  • getTextColour() --> int wj.C
  • getBackgroundColour() --> int wj.Oc
  • getInvSpritePadX() --> int wj.Fc
  • getInvSpritePadY() --> int wj.J
  • getSelectedActionName() --> jd wj.sc
  • getSpellName() --> jd wj.i
  • getToolTip() --> jd wj.Ic
  • getNotInterfaceSelectedModelType() --> int wj.Jb
  • getNotInterfaceSelectedModelID() --> int wj.qc
  • getInterfaceSelectedModelType() --> int wj.cd
  • getInterfaceSelectedModelID() --> int wj.rb

[ InterfaceXY ]

  • getInterfaceX() --> int wj.P
  • getInterfaceY() --> int wj.Fb

[ Signlink ]

  • getEventQueue() --> java.awt.EventQueue of.b
  • getGameApplet() --> java.applet.Applet of.h
  • getCurrentPassword() --> jd pd.nb
  • getCurrentUsername() --> jd pd.lb

[ Client ]
^ client implements interface Client

  • getInterfaceCache() --> wj[][] fi.b
  • getMouse() --> d ng.jb
  • getIdleTime() --> int qa.E
  • getKeyboard() --> fc fi.k

[ ValidInterfaceArray ]

  • getValidInterfaceArray() --> boolean[] ej.b

[ Mouse ]

  • getMouseX() --> int ib.pb
  • getMouseY() --> int tf.J
  • getMousePressX() --> int pe.o
  • getMousePressY() --> int aj.n
  • getMousePressButton() --> int da.a
  • getMousePressLastButton() --> int md.e
  • getMousePressTime() --> long di.B

[ LoginIndex ]

  • getLoginIndex() --> int nc.Z

[ SettingArray ]

  • getSettingArray() --> int[] pf.P

[ Item ]
^ w implements interface Item

  • getItemID() --> int w.x
  • getItemStackSize() --> int w.u

[ WorldController ]

  • getGroundArray() --> sa[][][] ik.v
    ^ sa implements interface Ground
    ^ s implements interface ObjectDefinition
  • getUID5() --> long s.a
    ^ h implements interface ObjectDefinition
  • getUID2() --> long h.e
    ^ al implements interface ObjectDefinition
  • getUID1() --> long al.n
    ^ de implements interface ObjectDefinition
  • getUID3() --> long de.o
    ^ oa implements interface ObjectDefinition
  • getUID4() --> long oa.o
  • getObject5Array() --> s[] sa.z
  • getObject2() --> h sa.D
  • getObject1() --> al sa.G
  • getObject3() --> de sa.I
  • getObject4() --> oa sa.O

[ SkillExperiencesMax ]

  • getSkillExperiencesMax() --> int[] gh.Y

[ Skills ]

  • getSkillLevelMaxes() --> int[] kh.h
  • getSkillLevels() --> int[] al.j
  • getSkillExperiences() --> int[] ge.h

[ Minimap ]

  • getMinimapInt3() --> int te.F
  • getCurveCos() --> int[] id.b
  • getCurveSin() --> int[] id.f
  • getMinimapInt2() --> int jd.q
  • getMinimapInt1() --> int pd.gb

[ Node ]
^ jb implements interface NodeSub
^ ce implements interface Node

  • getID() --> long ce.g
  • getNext() --> ce ce.j
  • getPrevious() --> ce ce.m

[ NodeList ]

  • getNodeListArray() --> rk[][][] fa.U
    ^ rk implements interface NodeList
  • getHead() --> ce rk.f
  • getCurrent() --> ce rk.u

[ CachedItem ]
^ lb implements interface CachedItem

  • getItem() --> w lb.w

[ Chat ]

  • getChatMessages() --> jd[] jb.s
  • getChatTypes() --> int[] we.d
  • getChatNames() --> jd[] q.n

[ Menu ]

  • getMenuOptionsCount() --> int n.R
  • isMenuOpen() --> boolean qh.Yb
  • getMenuX() --> int lf.d
  • getMenuY() --> int ua.H

[ MenuRSString ]

  • getMenuOptions() --> jd[] wh.o
  • getMenuActions() --> jd[] aj.t

[ ActionConstants ]

  • getActionID() --> short[] pf.u
  • getActionCmd1() --> long[] tb.Z
  • getActionCmd2() --> int[] jk.a
  • getActionCmd3() --> int[] ic.f

[ Flagged ]
